Constructor Detail

Hex

public Hex(Edge aFirstEdge)
Method Detail

getEdge

public Edge getEdge(int i)
Returns the i-th edge of this hex, where edge 0 is the first edge (the right, vertical edge) and edges 1-5 are obtained by preceding in a counterclockwise direction.

Parameters:
i -
Returns:

addEdge

public Hex addEdge(Edge anEdge)
Used to build a hex's "list" of edges. Appends the given edge to the hex's "list" of edges, meaning: starting with the last entry in myEdge, walks the list of edges in a counterclockwise direction until the list runs out. Then adds the given edge as the next edge in the counterclockwise direction from the last edge found.

Parameters:
anEdge -
Returns:
This hex, for chained calls.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
For debugging.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

enteredViaEdge0Minus

private boolean enteredViaEdge0Minus(int anEdgeIndex)
Returns true iff the indicated edge (in myEdge) is entered via its e0minus neighbor edge when traversing edges of this hex in counterclockwise order. Requires myEdge to have a value at given index.

Parameters:
anEdgeIndex - Must be in range [1..5].
Returns:

enteredViaVertex0

private boolean enteredViaVertex0(int anEdgeIndex)
Returns true iff the indicated edge (in myEdge) is entered via its vertex 0 when traversing edges of this hex in counterclockwise order. Requires myEdge to have a value at given index.

Parameters:
anEdgeIndex - Must be in range [1..5]
Returns:
